title: 2-year-old shot in abdomen in N. Houston
content:
HOUSTON - A 2-year-old boy is recovering after being flown by Lifeflight to the Texas Medical Center for a gunshot wound to the abdomen.
The child was shot inside an apartment at the Bayou Oaks Apartments on Ella Boulevard near the North Freeway and Rankin Road in north Houston.
HPD investigators say they got the call around 8 p.m. There were three or four adults inside the apartment at the time, along with the boy and his twin.
Right now police aren't sure how the toddler got shot, whether he got hold of the weapon, or if he was shot by someone else, because they say they can't get a straight story out of the adults who were inside.
"We don't have any weapons recovered right now," says Lt. Larry Crowson. "Right now we're getting conflicting statements about exactly what happened inside the apartment."
Although the boy was flown by Lifeflight and taken to surgery, he is expected to survive.
Police decided to take the adults who were inside at the time of the shooting to the Mykawa substation to continue questioning so they can figure out exactly how the child was shot.
2016 Click2Houston/KPRC2
